links.quantification: Satellite validation: 200 EVs = 1.1% NO2 reduction → quantifies ₹30K Cr health benefits → evidence for subsidy justification
Evidence links EV subsidies to health outcomes → ₹10K Cr FAME subsidy justified by ₹30K Cr health savings → ROI demonstration
Real-time NO2 data → evidence-based policy design → targeted EV deployment in high-pollution corridors → optimizes impact
Hyperlocal NO2 tracking → ward-level health improvements visible → community buy-in for EV adoption → social mobilization
Attribution challenge: TROPOMI 1km² resolution → hard to isolate EV impact from other factors → requires ground-truthing
Requires baseline data: Need 3-year pre-EV NO2 baseline → monitoring infrastructure before validation → data infrastructure first
Evidence → policy → more EVs → better air → health improvements → political support → stronger policies (reinforcing)
Via health tracking: NO2 reduction → respiratory illness -15% → school attendance improves → community wellbeing
Via emissions reduction: Better air quality → urban tree health +20% → pollinator habitat improves → ecosystem recovery
